sources.title: Texas Buddies
sources.description: Title: Texas Buddies Summary: Kincade and Blake cause a mail plane carrying a payroll to make a forced landing in the desert. When they try to get the money, prospectors Ted and Si drive them away. With the pilot shot, ... Directed by: Robert N. Bradbury Actors: Production Company: Trem Carr Pictures Release Date: 19 October 1932 (USA) Aspect Ratio: 1.37 : 1 Kincade and Blake cause a mail plane carrying a payroll to make a forced landing in the desert. When they try to get the money, prospectors Ted and Si drive them away. With the pilot shot, Ted takes over as pilot figuring another attempt will be made and this time the Sheriff will be there.

sources.title: Texas Buddies (1932) BOB STEELE
sources.description:
Stars: Bob Steele, Nancy Drexel, Francis McDonald 
 Director: Robert N. Bradbury

 Kincade and Blake cause a mail plane carrying a payroll to make a forced landing in the desert. When they try to get the money, prospectors Ted and Si drive them away. With the pilot shot, Ted takes over as pilot figuring another attempt will be made and this time the Sheriff will be there.

metadata.Plot: Kincade and Blake cause a mail plane carrying a payroll to make a forced landing in the desert. When they try to get the money, prospectors Ted and Si drive them away. With the pilot shot, Ted takes over as pilot figuring another attempt will be made and this time the Sheriff will be there.
metadata.Actors: Bob Steele, Nancy Drexel, Francis McDonald
